meanings.definition: Fail to reach the required standard in (an examination, test, or course).
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't flunk my math test tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study, you might flunk the exam.
meanings.sent3: Trying to flunk on purpose is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: Her lack of preparation caused her to flunk the quiz.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of flunking can be serious.

meanings.definition: A failure in an examination, test, or course.
meanings.sent1: His low score on the final led to a flunk.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a flunk can be disappointing.
meanings.sent3: Getting a flunk made him realize he needed to study more.
meanings.sent4: The flunk on her report card was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: She felt discouraged after seeing the flunk on her paper.
